title: Financial Growth
description: Assess how you're developing financially as a couple

questions.text: I feel we're getting better at handling money together over time.

therapeutic.rationale: Perceiving financial growth—even in small ways—builds confidence and motivation. Couples who feel they're improving stay engaged with their financial life together.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different perceptions of growth may mean one partner sees progress the other doesn't. Share specific improvements you've noticed.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared sense of financial growth together is motivating and builds partnership.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How have you grown in handling money together? What's improved?

questions.text: I believe we learn from our financial mistakes together.

therapeutic.rationale: Learning from mistakes—rather than blaming or shaming—creates growth. Couples who treat financial missteps as learning opportunities improve over time.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If one partner doesn't feel mistakes become learning, explore what happens after financial missteps. Is there blame? Avoidance? Discussion?
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared commitment to learning from mistakes creates resilient financial partnership.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What's a financial mistake you've learned from together? What changed?

questions.text: I feel comfortable discussing how to improve our financial habits.

therapeutic.rationale: Comfort discussing improvements suggests a growth mindset and safe communication. Discomfort may indicate fear of criticism or defensiveness.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If one partner is uncomfortable with improvement discussions, explore what makes it difficult. Framing matters—growth vs. criticism.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared comfort discussing improvements enables ongoing development as a financial team.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What financial habit would you like to improve together? Can you discuss this openly?

questions.text: I believe my partner wants to grow financially as much as I do.

therapeutic.rationale: Believing your partner is equally committed to financial growth creates teamwork. Feeling like you're the only one who cares creates resentment.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If one partner doubts the other's commitment to growth, discuss financial aspirations. Sometimes caring looks different than expected.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared commitment to financial growth creates aligned motivation.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What does financial growth mean to you? Does your partner share this aspiration?

questions.text: I feel optimistic about our financial future together.

therapeutic.rationale: Optimism about your financial future together reflects confidence in your partnership and trajectory. This positive outlook helps you persist through challenges.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If one partner is less optimistic, explore specific concerns. Targeted pessimism is more addressable than general doom.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared optimism about your financial future creates energy and motivation.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What makes you optimistic—or worried—about your financial future together?
